section.name: MVC Page model
section.p: Every web page (be it HTML or WML) rendered by ObjectLedge MVC subsystem consists of following elements:

ul.li: main Builder selected by view request parameter
a number of enclosing Builders which work as a multi-level layout (number of those builders is 0 up to configured maxEnclosures number)
a number of possibly embedded page Components

section.p: The following illustration shows the page structure. Boxes with a black outline are Builders. Dark grey boxes are components. The white box with black outline is the main Builder selected by the request view parameter.

The central part of the page model is a selected Builder and it's template. Templates and Builders are selected partly separately in order to allow use of template-only builders - great for creation of layouts shared between builders.
